publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3322 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Peace Day—That the Parliament recognises and supports international world peace day on 21 September 2005; believes that the day should be marked in the Parliament in future years using Time for Reflection as a formal call for world peace, and calls on the Scottish Executive to institute an educational programme in every primary and secondary school to highlight world peace day and a national day of peace.
S2M-3322 Peace Day (lodged on 20 September 2005) Campbell Martin*, Mike Pringle*, Tommy Sheridan*, Bill Butler*, Marlyn Glen*, Ms Sandra White*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-3322 Peace Day (lodged on 20 September 2005) Linda Fabiani*, Cathy Peattie*

S2M-3322 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Peace Day—That the Parliament recognises and supports international world peace day on 21 September 2005; believes that the day should be marked in the Parliament in future years using Time for Reflection as a formal call for world peace, and calls on the Scottish Executive to institute an educational programme in every primary and secondary school to highlight world peace day and a national day of peace. Supported by: Campbell Martin, Mike Pringle, Tommy Sheridan, Bill Butler, Marlyn Glen, Ms Sandra White, Dr Jean Turner, Linda Fabiani, Cathy Peattie, Chris Ballance*
S2M-3322 Peace Day (lodged on 20 September 2005) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3322 Peace Day (lodged on 20 September 2005) Shiona Baird*
S2M-3322 Peace Day (lodged on 20 September 2005) John Swinburne*
S2M-3322 Peace Day (lodged on 20 September 2005) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3322 Peace Day (lodged on 20 September 2005) Elaine Smith*
